newsitem.title: GERMANY: SAP says sales growth to outstrip costs.
newsitem.headline: SAP says sales growth to outstrip costs.

text.p: German software group SAP AG, currently the target of an insider trading probe, said on Wednesday that growth in sales should exceed the rise in costs this year.

Chief executive Dietmar Hopp also told SAP's annual general meeting that strong first quarter earnings should not encourage the view the company's business forecast was too cautious. But he added that if the mark remains week this year, earnings could exceed management expectations.
In the text of a speech he was due to give to shareholders, Hopp said his target was to raise sales by one billion marks this year from last year's 3.722 billion marks.
He added: "That will be accompanied by a cost increase which will be lower than the rise in sales."
Last month SAP announced first quarter sales up 49 percent to 1.032 billion marks, helped by the strong dollar, while pre-tax profits jumped 54 percent to 181 million marks.
